pageContext.claim: “What he [Biden] did with Clarence Thomas was a disaster, it was a disaster the way he treated Clarence Thomas. A black man, a great justice, as it turns out. But go back to those horrible days, the way he treated Clarence Thomas, they write books about it.”
pageContext.analysis: Biden was chairman of the Senate Judiciary Committee in 1991 and presided over the Supreme Court confirmation hearings for Clarence Thomas, a Republican appointee who was confirmed and became the court's second black jurist. Thomas maintains that the hearings were a spectacle designed to thwart his nomination and damage his reputation -- "a high-tech lynching," in Thomas's words -- but many Democrats say Biden went easy on him and failed to properly vet allegations from Anita Hill, who testified that Thomas sexually harassed her when he was the head of the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission. "Biden failed to use the powers afforded to Senate committee chairmen to conduct a judicious and thorough inquiry into Hill’s allegations," The Washington Post reported. "He did not give full consideration to witnesses whose allegations seemed to corroborate her testimony or curb the attacks and innuendo leveled at her during the hearing. A former Biden lawyer told The Washington Post this month that the Democrats were outmaneuvered by Republicans, whose purpose was to damage Hill."
